p: Nanocomposites, in which DNA fragments were electrostatically bound to TiO 2 NPs pre-covered with polylysine, efficiently inhibited human influenza A (subtype H3N2) (Levina et al. 2014). Composites of peptide nucleic acids with TiO 2 NP-containing DNA/peptide nucleic acid duplexes inhibited reproduction of influenza A virus (H3N2 subtype) with an efficiency of 99% and they were shown to not only penetrate through cell membranes, but also exhibit a high specific antisense activity without toxic effects on the living cells (Amirkhanov et al. 2015).
